titlepage.titleproper: Preliminary Inventory to the Nicolae George Caranfil Papers, 1914-1970
titlepage.publisher:
Hoover Institution Archives
Stanford University
Stanford, California
titlepage.p: © 1998 Hoover Institution Archives. All rights reserved.

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.abstract: Correspondence, reports, printed matter, diaries, maps, photographs, and memorabilia, relating to Romania in World Wars I and II, and to the work of the Romanian Relief Committee, the Romanian Red Cross, Humanitas, Caroman, Radio Free Europe, and the Romanian National Committee.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Nicolae George Caranfil Papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

did.unittitle: Diaries and momentos from World War I, 1916-1918; the mission to Paris; the armistice
Files concerning the production and distribution of electricity in Romania, 1931; negotiations with the Americans; radio talks by N. Caranfil, 1951-1953

English memorandum concerning the Romanian situation, 1944-1945; French notes and memoranda concerning the Romanian situation, 1945; correspondence with George Duca, 1945-1951; participants in the Toronto Red Cross conference, 1955; organization and activities of the welfare organization "Humanitas," 1950-1959

Papers concerning the drafting of the memorandum about the Toronto Red Cross conference, 1952; the press and the Red Cross conference; memoranda of the East European Red Cross at the Toronto conference; memoranda concerning the Free Red Cross organizations in Central and East Europe, Toronto conference; correspondence with the signatories of the Toronto conference, 1951-1952; papers concerning the memorandum; material concerning the League of Red Crosses

scopecontent.p: This addition to the collection has not yet been described.
